comment.text:
Best Phanaeng curry I have had in Georgia.  Period.  
Short rib Phanaeng curry with Thai rice.  A perfect glass of Cabernet to go with.  Sat at the bar, and had amazing service.   Very refreshing.   Thank you for a great experience! I'll be back.

owner_replies.comment: We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your experience with us! We look forward to your next visit, Lori! -Chef Nan Niyomkul

comment.text: A colleague and I went to Nan for lunch last week; my first time there in several years. Service is still impeccable - attentive but quietly so. Food was fabulous. I had the pan seared scallops. Perfectly cooked with a fabulous sauce and green beans. Really nice to have an Atlanta mainstay consistently being top notch after all these years.

Nice elegant restaurant. Not your average Thai restaurant. The place is great for a date or celebration. The atmosphere is elegant and relaxing. There is valet parking only. The drinks are very strong with the mango Magarita being the best. The food is fresh and flavorful. The basil fried rice and shrimp padthai was awesome! I would definitely recommend. Staff wears gloves, mask and social distancing is practiced.
Cool memorabilia everywhere. Great service. Took a customer and really enjoyed the ambiance. The appetizers tower was super cool recommend trying!

you can not go wrong with whatever you order here. i have been coming to nan for years and have loved everything ive ever tried. some of our repeat orders are the satay kai (chicken skewers), pla muk thod (calamari), kai siam (chicken + vegetable rice), and kai yang massaman (chicken curry). the drinks were phenomenal too. highly recommend the winter special butterfly pea flower drink!

photos.caption: panang talay (only w prawns) and kra pow nuea

comment.text:
I went on a date with a friend from out of town. The atmosphere was upscale and quiet with very nice decorations. Our server was attentive and helpful as well. 

My date ordered a vegetarian curry and I ordered the Lamb Hung Lay and y'all!!!! The curry the lamb was bathed in was so thick and creamy. The lamb itself was the perfect texture, soft and tender with still a bit of chew. It was perfect. My only complaints were the potato pieces in the curry were a bit underdone and the whole ginger shavings on top were a bit much to compliment the dish but I just pushed them aside and dug in.

The meal came with a cucumber salad was was deliciously refreshing and a yellow rice that was a bit much for such a flavorful meal. I would have preferred a plain white rice to accompany my meal. 

We also ordered the dragonfruit margaritas our server recommended and it was FABULOUS. All in all I will definitely be back for that curry. I dream of it.

This Thai restaurant is top 2 for us, and it ain't number 2. This place is perfect for date night and celebrations. Guys, if you're trying to wine and dine her this is the place. Just be ready to spend that check 
.
.

*Tom Yum Talay 10/10
See that tiny little piece of pepper? That thing will have you contemplating life. 
*Play Muk Thod (Calmari) 7/10 we've had better 
*Geah Yang (BBQ lamb chops) 10/10 
These things fell off the bone. 

We also recommend Tom Kha Kung and The Emerald (8 oz Filet Mignon) that are not pictured. 

Overall, besides the calamari, 10/10. We will definitely be back when we wanna ball out.
Nan was a vibe. We went for my birthday dinner and really enjoyed ourselves.  Everyone was pleased with the food and the drinks were strong.  The service was really good as well.

Hands down the most exquisite presentation and most delicious Thai food ever.  And our server Jaaeeyon (sp?) Was extraordinary.  So kind friendly knowledgeable and gave over the top service. 

I would eat here every day.  The food the ambiance and decor?  Excellent.  I have driven past here many times.  Who knew this was on the inside?

I have no words to describe this place other than if I could drink lychee martinis all day and eat seafood, it's definitely hard not to NOT want to come here. The food is incredible. I'm shocked I've never even come here before yesterday.

Literally everything we had was ridiculously amazing. Calamari, spring rolls, some chicken thing....yes please and thank you. The entree was lobster and more seafood. 

In. Love. Also, is the bathroom really a bathroom? I'm thinking it's like some type of spa. For real.

My husband and I decided to visit for a date night dinner. We made reservations online and arrived for the dinner service. Upon arrival the valet workers were very friendly. Once we entered the restaurant, we were greeted with warmth. The design and architect of the restaurant was very elegant. Our waitress was very kind and informative of the menu. I enjoyed the diversity of the menu including the cocktails and entrees. We started with the ginger blossom and dragon fruit cocktail. For my entree I ordered the Kai Yang Massaman (Grilled lemongrass chicken breast, massaman curry, avocado, green bean, roasted cashew nut, pickled shallot, cucumber salad, jasmine rice) and my husband ordered the Thai Barbecue Lamb Chops with Crispy Lobster Tail. This was by far the best curry and flavorful chicken I've had. The curry was sweet and savory with a light kick. I highly suggest getting this dish. Additionally I appreciate the chefs for accommodating my gluten free and dairy free lifestyle!

photos.caption: Thai Barbecue Lamb Chops with Crispy Lobster Tail

comment.text: Great food, and amazing Prosecco. The service was amazing and fast. I had the curry, some of the best curry I've ever eaten. And if you like cucumber salad, there's is amazing.

We love Thai cuisine. This is lovely with a nice bar and really good service. Food is a mix of excellent traditional Thai dishes and continental dishes with a Thai twist - very creative. Complimentary valet parking. Midtown, Give it a go.

Updated review after 5 years:

We came here for a business lunch, with 2 vegetarians in our team and two omnivores.  This 4-diamond restaurant is regarded as one of the best Thai restaurants in Atlanta.  Its easy to see why, with the gorgeous well-lighted interior, friendly and prompt service, and sizable menu of both traditional Thai-dishes and interesting fusion dishes.

The Nan Tasting Tree is a great shareable appetizer sampler for four people.  Solid dishes were calamari and chicken satay.  For vegetarians they had spring rolls, and half of the fried egg rolls (the other half contains shrimp).  Overall pretty good, though one dish was not my favorite - chicken dumplings were a bit bland.

Lobster Pad Thai was an expensive ($45!) entree and had a fried half lobster tail along with a skewer of sautéed scallops.  Both were seasoned well, though texture-wise a bit chewier than I liked.  Pad Thai itself was on the sweet side.  Not sure I would order this again since I prefer "too spicy" as opposed to "too sweet."  

IMHO, the best Thai food seems to have a bit of both - in-your-face spicy followed by some sweetness and acidity.  If I come back here in the future, I'll probably stick to the traditional Thai dishes.
I thought our food was fabulous. We asked for no spice and we got what we asked for. Delicious.

First and foremost this restaurant gets five stars. The experience was exceptional and memorable from the valet to the excellent wine selection and staff. The intimacy made me feel as if I was more than a dinner patron but part of their family.

I had the savory Lamb Hung Lay that left my mouth watery and tastebuds buzzing. The atmosphere is upscale and the dining room floor is very inviting. Perfect place for a date or celebratory dinner.

 P.S. I recommend the tea créeme brûlée for desert. Definitely on my favorite restaurant list!
Wonderful service, food, & cocktails. Highly recommend. We tried a variety of dishes and none disappointed!

I was excited to return after many years. Then I was saddened to see the poor level of service and managerial comportment. After leaving part our order out, Alex pretty much disregarded us as guests. We asked for a manager and eventually had to flag down Tou after to share our concerns. In sum, I've never experienced a manager who excelled in mediocrity and ineptitude. He was defensive, offensive, and exquisitely ill equipped to navigate complexity and keep the customers business. That he 'bore no ill will' was the cake and the icing. Never again.

Nan continues to be one of my favorite spots in Midtown for a nicer pre-theatre meal.  We enjoyed yet another great meal here on Feb 15th when they were serving a slightly reduced menu (but not a prix fixe menu) for Valentines weekend.

As usual, the service is great from the moment you walk in and are welcomed with a traditional Thai greeting.  The servers at Nan in my experience are consistently very good to great. 

On this occasion we enjoyed the following:

Calamari - lightly fried and served with a tamarind dipping sauce.  This is one of the best versions of this classic appetizer I've had in the city.

Lobster Pad Thai - a full lobster tail served with a mildly spicy version of this classic.  Excellent dish that was on the Valentines weekend menu.

Kai Siam -  chicken breast stir fried with chili, onions, cashew nuts, and other veggies served on a fresh cut portion of pineapple and with a delicious pineapple fried rice.  First time I've had this dish and it won't be the last.  I normally lean toward the spiciest Thai dishes, but this relatively mild dish was absolutely delicious. 

For dessert, we enjoyed the Coconut Cake served with Coconut Ice Cream.  It's a large dish and definitely suitable to share.

It is great to see Chef Nan's flagship restaurant continuing to execute their food and service in such a fantastic manner.
I love the ambience of this place! The food was really good. The service was a little slow but the place was packed! It also my first "Thai Fine Dining" experience!

photos.caption: Prawns, Minced Chicken, and Green Beans!

comment.text:
I would have loved to give more stars but now thing blew me away. 

I ordered the Pad Thai dish to see how amazingly they could elevate it since it's "fine dining".... Sorry but I've had better at Pei Wei.... 

The service was excellent, the atmo was nice and dim, nice candle lights everywhere and suitable for a nice date night. 

I would dine here again and see if maybe they can blow my socks off.
Oh my god. This was easily the most delicious and unique Thai food I've ever had. The atmosphere is gorgeous and the service is superb, but honestly, the food speaks for itself. Unreal!!!!!

Atlanta's Four Diamond Winning Thai Restaurant offers an upscale Thai cuisine with exotic spices and an elegant interior design! This will be a perfect place for you if you're planning a date night this weekend.

photos.caption: Kai Yang Masaman $22 Grilled lemongrass chicken breast in massaman curry with avocado, green beans, cashew nuts, and cucumber salad
Geah Yang $38 Thai-Style BBQ lamb chops with green papaya salad, roasted peanuts and sticky rice
Coconut Cake $9 Chocolate lava cake with Thai Ice cream $11
Ka-nom Jeeb -- 9 Shrimp and chicken Thai dumplings with roasted chili, lime leaves, with galangal mushroom soy sauce

comment.text: Oh my... the Siam ruby was absolutely delicious. The scallops were cooked to perfection and it had just the right amount of veggies and sauce. The plate filled me up more than I expected. Also all the drinks I tried are absolutely delicious.

Fine dining?  I had fat in my chicken dish, the fried calamari was very small yet expensive, the egg rolls tasted manufactured, and the coconut cake was stale. This place has really gone down hill, sadly.

Fancy n delicious!!!
I would give 5 stars but they had couple flies around our table......

A friend and i went to NAN last for his birthday dinner and it was amazing. I hadn't been in at least 5yrs and they didn't disappoint. The atmosphere was comfortable yet classy, service was good, our waitress was very pleasant and our food didn't take long to come out.  We had  the Pla Muk Thod calamari and 5 mango rice cocktails obviously it was good, Tom Kha Kung soup, the Snapper and the Siam Ocean and all of it was delicious. 
We enjoyed everything so much i forgot to take pictures. This will definitely be added as one of our favs.

Visited about 7 years ago and was anxious to see if it was as good as I remembered--yes it was. 
Elegant and superb quality.  
You feel good when you walk in the door and even better as you leave.  Appetizers were good, especially the small purses and the spring rolls but the seafood curry was stellar.  Can't wait to return

Came here for right after I proposed to my girl and they had the best service and food for the occasion!
 They even had a complimentary roses and dessert

Great Thai food is hard to find. Great 'fine dining' Thai is even harder to find. Sadly, this was not the place for great Thai. 

Food:
Fried rice to share
Tom yum soup
Fried dover sole with minced chicken

The food was overall average. Nothing really stood out. The fried rice was favorful, but it should never be  more than $20 for a plate. There is no justification for rice to be that expensive in any type of restaurant. Unless maybe there is gold flakes and truffles added. 

Tom yum soup was just broth with some flavoring and shrimp and scallions. This was the biggest disappointment. 

The fish was fine. It was de-boned and skinned. I wished the skin remained on. It would be nice to have the crispy skin. My favorite part of the fish was the minced chicken. 

Our waitress (Dawn) was super nice and helpful!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you very much for dining with us. For the past two decades we have prided ourselves on providing impeccable dining experiences and we obviously failed on your recent visit. Please let your server or management know of any dislikes on future visits and they will gladly help choose another dish to your liking. We hope you will dine with us again in the future. It will be our pleasure to have you back.

comment.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Atlanta.  Food is amazing (great and unique flavors) with wonderful presentation.  Outstanding staff and service.  And unlike so many restaurants today that are dark and small, the Nan dinning room is bright, airy (2 stories high) and beautiful. Atlanta fine dining (Asian cousins or otherwise) at its absolute best.

Good Thai cuisine place. Had the duck curry plate with side of rice, priced at $26 and my partner had the chicken massaman curry for $22. We had a veggie rice paper roll for $9. All to say that the food, although yummy, was over-priced. Definitely not Buford Highway prices. However, ambiance and friendly/attentive customer service made up for that. Great date night restaurant. Free valet but please tip the guy:) Enjoy.

photos.caption: Duck red spicy and sweet curry dish

comment.text: We went for the first time last night to celebrate my husband's birthday. We started with the calamari which was amazing. The chili sauce was so good! My husband ordered the lamb and I had the sea bass. Both were truly excellent. My husband said it's now his favorite lamb. We also had a order of the fried pineapple rice which was delicious. We finished with the lychee ice cream and the custard. Truly a fantastic meal and we'll be back.

------FOOD & DRINKS------

I had the masaman curry. It was good but I wish they had given more rice as the ratio of rice to curry was off. 

------ATMOSPHERE------

A classy upscale establishment near Atlantic station. Great place for birthdays / anniversaries. 

------PRICE------

It is an expensive place but the food is worth it. You also have to remember that you are paying for the atmosphere as well. 


WOULD I COME BACK? 

I don't think so. Not a fan of Thai food.

I like good Thai food, it brings out the ultimate tastebud experience that we all should learn to enjoy and cherish. Nan brings that out 100%.

The staff is extremely friendly and they try to implement the Thai customs to making it pleasant when you eat there. While the prices are a bit high, $20 a person for dinner, the portions are not tiny at all. It is a healthy amount of food to the point where it is satisfying enough to feel good that you spent your money well. I also liked the Tom Yum soup which was a great mix of spice and savory. They also did not skimp on the seafood, which so many Thai restaurants tend to do. 

The restaurant also has valet parking for those who want to drive there. 

One little tip, do not come here with a hat or tank tops. While it is rather informal, I would come dressed a bit nicer so that way the staff treats you better. Also, be nice to the staff. They work hard to ensure that you are having a wonderful experience from the time you are seated until the time you walk out of the restaurant.

I have been dining at Nan for years. It is my mother's favorite place and I see why. The level of service has never wavered, it has been of the best quality each and every time. 

The only thing that out shines the service is the culinary  wonderment that comes out of the open kitchen. The chef, sous chefs and everyone else should be proud. The surf and turf aka lobster fried rice w/ lamb chops was sublime. The apps are small but packed with flavor and the beverages bring it all together. 

To have this level of sustained service for this many years is outstanding. Well done!!
Top notch service and food is always fresh and flavorful. Can't go wrong here and the mango margarita is my fave lord have mercy lol

This was my family's first time coming to this restaurant and all I can say is that, "I will not return ever!" The issue wasn't the food nor was it the ambiance; it was simply the waitress Liana who was the most inattentive and unfriendly person that I've come in contact with while dining out.  Me and my wife constantly had to remind her that we needed water, our alcoholic beverages were forgotten, and several times she attempted to rush us out of the restaurant. Some things/observations can be convoluted perceptions based on the lens that you're trying to view them from or make sense of, I couldn't make sense of her distasteful customer service.  Moreover, I'm not trying to give a class on "Class." I took the high road and I decided to give her a tip that was more than she should've received.  I hope that anyone else that dines here never has to leave Nan Thai Fine Dining in Atlanta with the perception that they're not welcomed.  

Sincerely never to return,

Terrance Simon (foodie and citizen)

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent dining experience with us. For the past two decades, we have prided ourselves on providing an exceptional customer experience; however, we obviously failed during your recent visit. We would love an opportunity to make up for your unsatisfactory experience and hope you will dine with us again in the future.

comment.text: From exceptional food presentation to exceptional service, Nan is by far my favorite Thai restaurant! While the lunch menu is a bit pricy, the food and service is worth every penny! The Tom Yum Talay (my first course) was perfect for the fall weather and every bite seemed to warm my soul! For my main course, my taste buds enjoyed every bite and were slightly disappointed when I finished the Kai Siam! Highly recommend this restaurant--A+!

I'd been looking forward to eating at Nan for three weeks since making our reservation for a holiday party. $700+ later and the service was awful, drinks were slow, and the food had to be sent back. It's a travesty that 22% gratuity was automatically added despite bad service and short staffed. Do better, Nan!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent dining experience with us. For the past two decades, we have prided ourselves on providing an exceptional customer experience; however, we obviously failed during your recent visit. We would love an opportunity to make up for your unsatisfactory experience and hope you will dine with us again in the future.

comment.text: This place has great Thai! I live in Virginia but I came here for a family event. I got the appetizer sampler which was very good. For my main course, I got the short rib dish. I really enjoyed it. Great place to go!

This has to be one of my FAV Thai Restaurants in Atlanta! 

The Restaurant has done a Exceptional Job with the Thailand decor and Menu. 

As you enter the restaurant you will notice how warm, clean and prestige it feels. 

Each time I've eaten at NAN I was greeted as I entered the Restaurant and never had to wait for a table. The Bar area is very nice and relaxed. The Bartender has always taken great care of me with attentive service and yummy Martinis. 

I suggest every Lady have a "meeting in the Ladies Room" in my KLYMAXX voice. The Bathrooms are clean, dimly lit with candles, nicely folded hand towels and soft music playing. Now, this is what a run to the Ladies Room is supposed to look and feel like! Ah-mazing! 

Lastly, my Dinner! Speechless...the food presentation and menu options, restaurant and bathroom decor, sparkling white table cloths and Exceptional Customer Service is UNBELIEVABLE! 

NAN knows what they're doing in the kitchen and outside the kitchen! 

NAN you are SIMPLY the BEST!
Great food, A plus service , food plated beautifully, great ambience, cocktails are amazing,

I went here with a big group for my birthday while on vacation and we did the Chef's Table, it was one of the most amazing meals I've ever had and definitely the best Thai food experience I've ever had in my life! All of the drinks were great, the service was impeccable, and all the food was excellent! A great way to spend a birthday.

I am thoroughly impressed! Thai food is one of our top favorite food to eat. We have tried so many different Thai places and have enjoyed so many different dishes. 
However, Nan Thai Fine Dining has surpassed them all! Our food included: Kai Siam, Chicken Pad Thai, Chicken Basil Fried Rice. 
The Kai Siam was an amazing crispy chicken dish that was very flavorful. Not only the chicken was cooked to perfection, the vegetables were coated in flavor. I definitely recommend getting this dish. 
The Chicken Pad Thai was to die for. I have had pad thai numerous times, but none compare to this one. The sauce that the pad Thai was made with was filled with flavor that every bite was like eating it for the first time all over. 
The Chicken Basil Fried Rice was amazing. Basil fried rice is supposed to be a simple dish that accompanies the main dish. However, this Basil fried rice was our favorite thing that we ordered. It not only was coated and covered in that aromatic taste, but it also was moist and so delicious! 

Overall, this was a great experience. Yes it is on the higher end, but it is completely worth every penny! 

Not to mention the staff! Bon our server served us as if we were his family. Explained and answered all our questions and made us feel comfortable ordering our food. 
Nam, the manager, came to our table and made us feel comfortable. And explained the amazing pad thai, which made us all the more excited about the food we ordered. 
I was so impressed by the food, and with the great service from the staff it just made our dinner experience the best we have ever had.
Tonight was absolutely perfect! The staff was on punt, the food was spectacular and the atmosphere delightful!

owner_replies.comment: Hello Janine, I am sorry to hear about your poor experience. We pride ourselves on providing excellent dining experiences and service is definitely one of our priorities. We would love to invite you back again for a better experience. -Chef Nan Niyomkul

comment.text: This place was wonderful. We were stuck in the house for our birthdays in April and May, so we had a late celebration out at Nan's. The appetizers were on point. Coconut shrimp soup was fabulous. All of our dishes were incredible. See descriptions with pictures. Our teenage sons began planning to come back for their birthday dinners before they even finished their food. Dessert was great too. Coconut cake and coconut ice cream were heavenly. Cream brûlée and chocolate mouse cake were yummy too. Also, the fired okra is not on the menu but they have it. Delish! Prices are a little on the higher end, but so worth every penny. Great celebration place or date night! Thanks to Mama Mia for a great evening!

photos.caption: LAMB HUNG LAY Slow-braised lamb shank in Northern Thai red curry, peanuts, potatoes, and ginger with coconut curry rice and cucumber salad
Coconut cake and coconut ice cream. It's a dream come true. So yummy.
KRA POW NUEA Sautéed sliced beef tenderloin with fresh Thai basil, garlic, bell peppers, and egg crepe
SEAFOOD PANANG TALAY Pan-seared jumbo prawns, calamari and sea scallops with Panang curry and sautéed green beans
SIAM RUBY Pan-seared jumbo sea scallops with Thai red curry, bamboo shoots, eggplant, Thai basil, green beans, and pumpkin red curry rice

comment.text:
Had a group of 16 and the staff did an outstanding job!  They were friendly, informative and on the spot with servicing the table.  We ordered a ton of dishes and everyone of them had a unique flavor and was prepared well.  A favorite was the sea bass with eggplant!  I have already recommended this to another corporate planner.  

They also have a great option for private dinning!

We were on a road trip that took us through Atlanta. In the mood for some Thai food, we found Nan, and it did not disappoint! We had the calamari and tea rose dumplings to start- both were delicious! The calamari was so light and crispy, and served with a tangy sauce. The dumplings were very unique, slightly sweet but also savory. We also split the Thai BBQ lamb chops, and everything about it was delicious! Cooked perfectly and such great flavors! Our waiter was so great as well.

Food: 8/10
Service: 10/10
Atmosphere: 8/10

An impromptu Sunday evening date with my wife ended up being a pretty memorable dining experience.  The interior combines a sleek and clean modern vibe with plenty of traditional Thai flair sprinkled in, and the open view into the kitchen is always fun.  My wife and I ordered a few different cocktails (and a Thai tea), all of which were well balanced and complimented the food.  Well-timed, helpful service made for a really relaxing and enjoyable time.

We ended up trying the tea rose (phenomenal and incredibly artfully made) and calamari (good, but not remarkable) for appetizers, and then went with the duck (very good and flavorful, but a tad overcooked for my liking) and the seafood curry Panang Talay.  The true star of the meal ended up being the incredible scallops, which were huge and perfectly cooked!  I really think this might have been among the best scallops I've ever had!

Next time I'd be curious to try the snapper special, but there will definitely be a next time now that we're aware of this gem.

photos.caption: Tea rose (Chau Moung) - tastes as good as it looks
